comment: Like another review said I agree that you should only take Professor Angulo if you can draw in heavy detail. He is extremely drawing heavy & you will 100% get behind if you don't understand the drawings. Most of the professors use the modern software but not him. Answers questions precisely and is very nice though.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Angulo is awesome. For those who don't have an art background, be warned that maybe this isn't the course/major for you, as it is very drawing heavy and it'll set you behind. He moves fast. Always wants you to improve no matter how good it may be, but is very kind when saying so. For anyone with an art background, should be an easy A if disciplined
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Professor Angulo is very nice. He will criticize during pin up, which is supposed to happen! He gives you chances to improve your assignments before submitting. He does however go through the modules faster than the other professors, which is either good or bad depending on the type of student you are.

Professor Angulo really strives for his students to do well. As long as you attend class and complete your work by the deadlines, you will be in good standing. He gives good advice during pinup and will encourage other students to critique/help with your drawings. He is willing to help if you put in the work and offers extra credit opportunities.

Professor Angulo was a good teacher. There is a lot of work in this class, but that is expected from any studio class. He cares about his students work. He gives you a lot of freedom in class and with homework (I mean he doesn't hound you for assignments), but that means you have to be mature enough to mage your work load accordingly.
Angulo Is a good Professor and Gives good active feedback
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lots of homework--Gives good feedback

comment: Very nice teacher, easy with due dates but too much homework.

Professor Angulo is not good at explaining things tasks. He's very tough at grading and wants you to redo things until they're perfect. He also doesn't respond to emails as fast as you want him to. Also, if you don't take his advice on your work, he'll get upset. Be prepared to do multiple all-nighters.

Does not articulate his needs for each project, and proceeds to make you redo it until perfection. There is also extremely long hours, especially for Angulos class. Be prepared to do many all nighters in a row.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Angulo is a really nice guy. This class was kind of hard because it was mostly online due to covid. Only met 1 time of the week in person. Sometimes he was not clear about the assignments, but he will let you redo if you wanted to. He will also try to have 1 on 1 to help you if you needed.

Great professor. Very kind with good feedback. Not a tough grader since it's studio 1 and no one really knows what they're doing. If you have an art background It'll be an easy A if you follow his directions. Sometimes assignments are unclear but you can just go on d2l to read it yourself. Let's you redo stuff for a better grade. Great guy!

Prof. Angulo is a very nice studio professor. His explanations of assignments were never really clear. But, he always lets you re-do for a second try. He also is super nice, he'd never tell you his work is terrible. He'll just ask you to nicely re-do it! Wouldn't take him if you're looking to be challenged in studio.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Angulo is an amazing professor. He went to school for architecture but learned it all by hand drawings, so he is a prefect professor to take for the first year. He is overall a very nice guy and allows you to design what you want but guides you through the process. All studio classes are going to be very hard but he is one of the best.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: He is new at KSU, but was very caring and empathetic with students time. Always gave us extra time to finish homework. He does have a bit a difficulty in passing his knowledge because of language barrier, but spends a lot of time 1x1.
